title:
Exploring the chiral magnetic effect in isobar collisions through Chiral
  Anomaly Transport
authors:
Zilin Yuan, Anping Huang, Guannan Xie, Wen-Hao Zhou, Guo-Liang Ma, Mei
  Huang
abstract:
We investigate the signal of the chiral magnetic effect (CME) in Au+Au
collisions and isobar collisions of $_{44}^{96}\text{Ru}+\rm{} _{44}^{96}Ru$
and $_{40}^{96}\text{Zr}+\rm{}_{40}^{96}Zr$ in the newly developed chiral
anomaly transport (CAT) module based on the state-of-the-art model a multiphase
transport (AMPT). Our numerical simulation results for the ratio charge
correlation $\Delta\gamma$ in Ru+Ru and Zr+Zr collisions are close to the
latest experimental data. The simulation shows that the CME signal is larger in
Ru+Ru collisions than that in Zr+Zr collisions, while the background is
smaller, and the upper limit of the CME signal is $15\%$ in the isobar
collisions.
